Identification.LongTitle: General Export Permit No. 41 — Dual-use Goods and Technology to Certain Destinations

Provision.Text: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to subsections 7(1.1)a and 10(1)b of the Export and Import Permits Actc, issues the annexed General Export Permit No. 41 — Dual-use Goods and Technology to Certain Destinations.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Permit.

Definition.Text: eligible destination means Australia, Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, the Republic of Korea, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom or the United States.
Export Controls Division means the Export Controls Division of the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development.
Guide has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Export Control List.

Subsection.Text: In this Permit, composite, development, matrix, production, software and user-accessible programmability have the same meaning as in the Guide under the heading “Definitions of Terms Used in Groups 1 and 2”.

Section.Text: Subject to sections 3 to 5, any resident of Canada may, under this Permit, export or transfer from Canada any good or technology referred to in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any item in Group 1 of the Guide; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: items 5504.2.a. to 5504.2.g. of the Guide.

Subsection.Text: This Permit does not authorize the export or transfer of goods or technology to a country

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is not an eligible destination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is listed in the Area Control List; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which an order or regulation has been made under section 4 of the Special Economic Measures Act or section 2 of the United Nations Act.

Subsection.Text: This Permit does not authorize the export or transfer of goods or technology that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are intended to be used in a country that is not an eligible destination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are referred to in the schedule to this Permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are referred to in any item of the Guide other than those referred to in section 2, unless the export or transfer is also authorized by another permit issued under subsection 7(1.1) of the Export and Import Permits Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: are referred to in any of subparagraphs 3(2)(c)(i) to (iii) of the Export Permits Regulations.

Subsection.Text: This Permit does not authorize the export or transfer of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: software that is specially designed or modified for the development or use of the goods or technology referred to in item 5504.2.h. or 5504.2.i. of the Guide; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: technology that is specially designed or modified for the development or production of the goods or technology referred to in item 5504.2.h. or 5504.2.i. of the Guide.

Section.Text: A resident of Canada who exports or transfers goods or technology under this Permit must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide in writing to the Export Controls Division, before making their first export or transfer under this Permit in a calendar year, the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, address, telephone number and, if any, their facsimile number and electronic mail address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the resident of Canada is a corporation, the business number assigned to the corporation by the Minister of National Revenue, the name of a contact person, the contact person’s address, telephone number and, if any, facsimile number and electronic mail address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide to the Export Controls Division, within 30 days after each six-month period ending on January 31 or July 31, a report containing the following information in respect of any export or transfer made under this Permit during that period:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of each consignee and, if any, the consignee’s facsimile number and electronic mail address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the consignee is a corporation, the name and title of a contact person who has knowledge of the export or transfer, and the contact person’s telephone number and, if any, facsimile number and electronic mail address,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of each good or technology exported or transferred and the item number of the Guide in which it is referred to, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity and value of each good or technology exported or transferred by country of destination;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: within 15 days after receipt of a request from the Export Controls Division, provide to the Export Controls Division the records referred to in section 5 in respect of any export or transfer made during the period specified in the request;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: insert the term “GEP-41” or “LGE-41” in the appropriate field of the form prescribed under the Customs Act if the good exported is required to be reported under that Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: obtain, before the export or transfer, a written statement from each consignee that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: identifies the country of end use of the good or technology, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indicates whether the consignee is an end-user or a distributor or, if the consignee is neither, describes the consignee’s role in relation to the export or transfer.

Section.Text: A resident of Canada who exports or transfers a good or technology under this Permit must retain, for a period of six years after the year in which the export or transfer is made, the following records in respect of that export or transfer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the export or transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each consignee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and value of the export or transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and any part number or unique identifier of the good or technology, as well as a description of the good or technology and its technical specifications;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the item number of the Guide in which the good or technology is referred to, and a comparison of the technical specifications set out in the item with the technical specifications of the good or technology;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written statement obtained from each consignee under paragraph 4(e); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a copy, if available, of any contract between the resident of Canada and each consignee and any invoice or export or shipping document relating to the export or transfer.

Section.Text: This Permit comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
